page.title: 12Education. Hospital school
page.content: St. Lawrence has a special school.It is a school for children that are badly burned or injured.The Head of the school is Mrs. Cavill,who has been Head for 7 years.The school can take 20-40 children.In the school there are 4 teachers and 3 nursery nurses.They teach the children in all subjects. It's more difficult to teach children who can't move,so they are taught in their beds.The school has been attached to the hospital for 34 years. The nurses look after the children after school hours.The most children they have had in the school at one time is 70.Children come from all over South Wales and over the border in England.If the Burns Unit is eventually moved from Chepstow then this very special school will have to close.
